title: How to Replace a Kenmore Lid Switch Assembly

steps.headline: Unplug the washer and disconnect the water hoses.
Remove the control panel from the top of the washer.
Disconnect the plug from the control panel.
steps.description: You will need a knife or straight edged screwdriver to press down or pry out the appropriate parts of the plug.

steps.headline: Feed it back through the opening that it is in.
If you haven't already, remove the spring clips that are on either side of the washer.
steps.description: This is what holds the frame of the washer to the body of it.

steps.headline: Carefully, remove the washer's metal cover from the washer body.
steps.description:
You will need to lay it on what would be its front so that you can access the lid switch assembly. This view is from inside the shell of the washer and underneath. For this view, you will need to be 'inside' the shell. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/de\/Interior-of-washer-lid-switch-assembly.jpg\/460px-Interior-of-washer-lid-switch-assembly.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/de\/Interior-of-washer-lid-switch-assembly.jpg\/760px-Interior-of-washer-lid-switch-assembly.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":505.27472527472526,"licensing":"

steps.headline: Carefully, remove the various clips that attach the assembly to the washer.
steps.description: Take note of where everything is.

steps.headline: Replace the assembly, after you have removed it.
Reassemble the washer.
steps.description: Be sure that you put everything where it came from.

text:
Unplug the washer and disconnect the water hoses. Remove the control panel from the top of the washer. Disconnect the plug from the control panel. You will need a knife or straight edged screwdriver to press down or pry out the appropriate parts of the plug. Feed it back through the opening that it is in. If you haven't already, remove the spring clips that are on either side of the washer. This is what holds the frame of the washer to the body of it. Carefully, remove the washer's metal cover from the washer body. You will need to lay it on what would be its front so that you can access the lid switch assembly. This view is from inside the shell of the washer and underneath. For this view, you will need to be 'inside' the shell. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/de\/Interior-of-washer-lid-switch-assembly.jpg\/460px-Interior-of-washer-lid-switch-assembly.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/de\/Interior-of-washer-lid-switch-assembly.jpg\/760px-Interior-of-washer-lid-switch-assembly.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":505.27472527472526,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Disconnect the grounding wire. Carefully, remove the various clips that attach the assembly to the washer. Take note of where everything is. Replace the assembly, after you have removed it. Reconnect the grounding wire. Reassemble the washer. Be sure that you put everything where it came from.
